org.robocup_logistics.llsf_encryption

Class BufferDecryptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.robocup_logistics.llsf_encryption.BufferDecryptor

  • public class BufferDecryptor
extends java.lang.Object
    The BufferDecryptor is responsible for decrypting incoming messages.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferDecryptor(java.lang.String key)
      Instantiates a new BufferDecryptor with an encryption key.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decrypt(int cipher, byte[] toDecrypt, byte[] iv)
      Decrypts an incoming message.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferDecryptor

        public BufferDecryptor(java.lang.String key)
                throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                       java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                       javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        Instantiates a new BufferDecryptor with an encryption key.
        Parameters:
        key - The encryption key as String
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(int cipher,
             byte[] toDecrypt,
             byte[] iv)
               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                      java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Decrypts an incoming message. This method is called by the ProtobufBroadcastPeer.
        Parameters:
        cipher - The cipher as defined in the refbox integration manual in section 2.2.1
        toDecrypt - Encrypted data as byte array
        iv - Initialization vector from the incoming message (pass null if you use ECB)
        Returns:
        Decrypted data as byte array
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
